scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 29 pharmacy and medicine bottles of various sizes produced or used by Brooklyn druggists, pharmacies, and pharmaceutical manufacturing companies, dating from around 1880 to 1920.

Pharmacies and druggists: Abraham and Straus; Le Roy Braswell, The Rexall Store (89 7th Avenue); Wm. (William) Buderus (90 Utica Avenue; 1726 Fulton Street); S. Chichester (357 Myrtle Avenue); Louis Crome, pharmacist (East 92nd Street, Canarsie); Davidson & Bulkley Pharmacy - Brooklyn Heights (84 Montague Street); Fifth Avenue Drug Company (Limited) (522 5th Avenue); J. L. House, druggist; F. A. Kattman, pharmacist; Neergaard's Pharmacy (225 5th Avenue); Parrish; Reid & Snyder, prescription experts (740 Flatbush Avenue); D. H. Starr (350 7th Avenue, corner 10th Street); and R. H. Thayer, drugist (33 Atlantic Avenue);

Pharmaceutical and medicinal products: Fougera's Eau Angelique tooth wash; Lyon Manufacturing Company - Hagan's Magnolia Blam (1919); Lyon Manufacturing Company - Mexican mustang liniment; and J. A. Vaughan - Lister's antiseptic liniment.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: The Edward R. Squibb collection (2008.021) contains additional material related to the Brooklyn pharmaceutical industry of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
